title: Lovely spot for a walk
text:
Mereweather Beach A lovely beach to visit in Newcastle. It was very choppy the day we visited but it was still spectacular to see the surfers do their thing and see the powerful waves crash to shore.
The bluff near the baths have interesting rocks to look at if you are interested in geology. Observed a few fossils and the rock pool great for kids.

title: Lovely beach
text: Mereweather Beach A couple of parking spaces in the parking and along the street. Clean beach with a cafe at the edge and also lifeguards and surfers. Perfect to just sit and watch or to wet your feet.

title: Worth a visit
text: Mereweather Beach What a stunning location - we loved the look out with the faux grass perfect for picnics - parking is more challenging but definitely worth  a visit

title: Not worth it
text: Mereweather Beach I lived here in 2022. This beach was really horrible. Superficial people, a beach destroyed by a disgusting beach club and a pub across the road full of superficial tossers.

title: Heavy Shore Breaking Waves made it Difficult to Enjoy the Surf
text: Mereweather Beach We visited this beach every day for a week. The shore break made it dangerous for anyone who was not good swimmer. Relief came from splashing in the wash. The facilities at the beach precinct are vey good, so a reasonably pleasant hour or two could be had here, but not so much in the water.

title: Oar sum
text: Mereweather Beach Excellent place for a walk and a swim. Was surprised there was so much parking available. Scenic and serene. One of the best parts of Newy

title: Such a beautiful spot
text: Mereweather Beach Bought lunch from Swell Kiosks and spent a few hours Merewether Beach watching our daughter playing with sand building. Such a beautiful spot.

title: Best beach
text: Mereweather Beach I love this beach as do my family, beautiful clean beach and friendly locals. Def a must visit attraction and the bathes,

title: Parking is a nightmare!
text: Mereweather Beach Don’t expect to come down here on a sunny weekend day and expect to park. Took us almost an hour to find a space. And that was just down to luck as we saw someone leaving. But the beach....wow.....it’s incredible.

title: Great beach section
text: Mereweather Beach Very busy beach area. The facilities were very busy as it was a nice day, but lots of toilets and showers. Still room on the beach. Stunning coastal walk along from Nobbys head

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Mereweather Beach Visited Merewether Beach recently for the first time & it was lovely.  It is patrolled by life guards.  Parking isn't that great, there is no car park so need to find street parking.  The surf club is amazing with a restaurant and a cafe down on beach level.  Easy to stay for the whole day.

title: Summer Australian Style
text:
Mereweather Beach Merewether beach is a great example of a typical Australian beach. The water is clean and bracing and it is never really that crowded.

There is also a large ocean pool.

title: Excellent
text: Mereweather Beach Easy to get a park, and the ocean baths were fantastic. Great for walking, swimming or dining. Scenic place

title: Stunning views and great food
text: Mereweather Beach Lovely lunch at Merewether Surf House today, prawn pizza and a cocktail in the sunshine. Nothing better!

title: Walk the promenade and enjoy the view
text: Mereweather Beach There are actually 3 beaches here with one long promenade, Merewether, Bar & Dixon Park beach. Views of the headland are spectacular as you want the promenade. Plenty of places to stop for coffee or brunch as you watch the surfers.

title: One of the beat beaches in Australia!
text: Mereweather Beach From the beach to the wonderful ocean baths, Merewether Beach is amazing all times of the year. We’ve smashed out fitness goals in winter with that long set of stairs and cold water swims, to cooling off in Summer with a splash in the waves. Great to watch the coal ships go past and we always seem to see at least 2 aircraft. A busy and friendly place that we’d recommended visiting if you’re looking for a beach along the Newcastle coastline.

title: Such a Beautiful Beach and Ocean View
text: Mereweather Beach A visit to Merewether Beach is must if you are visiting Newcastle - around 2kms away from the CBD it is a lovely beach. Long stretch of beach and an amazing ocean bath and pools. Paved so you can walk on a path or better if you want to walk along the sand or along the water. Great place for families and the ocean baths have lots of spaces suitable for toddlers, little kids, youth and adult. Such a nice atmosphere and lovely cafe with good food selection and coffee. Can sit and enjoy the views all day here.

title: One of the best views on the East Coast
text: Mereweather Beach This has to be one of the best beaches on the east coast, great views, great surf and great coffee from the Blue Door Kiosk, Coffee with a View!

title: Nice beach for a visit
text: Mereweather Beach Enjoyed viewing the Baths and the beach was lovely, very crowded so very popular.  We had a lovely day in Newcastle and this beach added to our joy.  Enjoy

title: Beautiful views
text: Mereweather Beach From Dixon Park to the other side of Merewether beach is  an easy walk with great views and two popular places to buy food and drinks.  Watching the morning sunrise on the waves is breathtaking.

title: Beautiful, clean sandy beach
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether Beach is awesome.  Well patrolled, clean and great for families as well as surfers.  It's home to some international surfing stars and locals love it too.

title: Wonderful 24hour 7 day swim
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether Beach wonderful. The baths more wonderful. Access 24 hours a day. Every day during hot days.

title: Lovely
text: Mereweather Beach This is the best surf beach in Newcastle in my opinion,  free parking, restaurants and change rooms and great surf,  also great for dog walking

title: Group visit
text: Mereweather Beach Combo of Merewether beach and bar beach are very nice. There’s some rock pools at the northern end. A cafe kiosk on the bar beach end and the mere weather surf house at southern end. Lots of parking (but does fill up) and a skate park across the road in the middle. Lots of families and it’s patrolled.

title: A great place for a swim
text: Mereweather Beach The Merewether Ocean Baths are a great place to swim.  Yep I am here again. They have an area for laps and a ramp for disability access. Ocean water fills the baths. They are pumped out and cleaned regularly. There is parking, public transport, a nice walking path, places to eat. A good place to visit.

title: Scenic & good for kids
text: Mereweather Beach Nice sand. There’s a pool spot for kids. Facilities available. Short walk into town for food.pretty beach.

title: gorgeous views at a popular summer beach for swimming
text: Mereweather Beach Part of a cruise ship shore excursion, this beach is popular with the locals,too. Dramatic backdrops for photo taking. Lovely  for strolling. expect high temperatures in December. Has places to eat, too.

title: Popular beach, great seaside walk too
text: Mereweather Beach Beautiful patrolled beach with lots of nearby parking. great place to take the family for a fun time. Lots of cafes nearby too.

title: A must do beach
text:
Mereweather Beach I will keep it simple.. Merewether beach is a MUST DO if you are in Newcastle 

Clean, patrolled, lots to do and see and good food. Go here and make good memories.

title: The Bondi of Newcastle
text: Mereweather Beach Awesome beach, great boardwalk that goes for miles. Much hype and activity, uphill walk, skating, cycling, dogs, kids, couples - parks and playgrounds.

title: Great place for a swim on a hot day
text: Mereweather Beach Easy parking nearby, clean beach for swimming, good coffee nearby, a bit of whale watching and general people watching.

title: Stunning beach and rock pools.
text: Mereweather Beach Had a beautiful evening swim in the rock pools after a long walk on the beach. Some very nice shells on the beach.

title: Great Beach
text: Mereweather Beach Very popular beach in Newcastle. The beach stretches from Merewether to Bar Beach with Dixon Park Beach in between. Great for walking or running along the beach.  Great location. Close to Merewether Ocean Baths, Cafes and a very popular pub across the road. What more could you ask for.

title: Nice promenade
text: Mereweather Beach I didn't go into the water as I'd got to Newcastle too late; but my host and I walked up and down the beach, and along the promenade. It's a nice beach for sure at dusk. Not far from the centre of town and its cafes and restaurants.

title: Simply stunning !
text: Mereweather Beach What more could you ask for than sitting on merewether beach having a fantastic lunch watching the board riders doing their thing in the waves A great safe beach and a amazing beach to walk along .Showers and toilet facilities are available .

title: Beautiful beach, cafes, parking, surfing - awesome
text: Mereweather Beach On a wonderful stretch of beaches from merewether up to Bar Beach, there is clear / clean water and plenty of parking. Two cafes and a restaurant right on the beach, with good facilities. Known for some good surfing and never crowded (unlike Sydney beaches).

title: Lovely !
text: Mereweather Beach Beautiful beach, lots of surf lifesaving, great coastal walks and if you add in the Memorial Walk too, you could walk for ages. Baths looked good but we didn't go in.

title: Newcastle Drive 2019
text: Mereweather Beach We drove along the coastal drive to Mereweather beach, great views of the ocean and rock formations, parking available, the ocean baths were not in use as the council was removing sand and cleaning them.

title: Stunning beach
text: Mereweather Beach Great food at the Surf club with wonderful views. The enclosed ocean baths are safe and great to swim in.

title: Fantasic beach
text: Mereweather Beach Spectacular Beach! Perfect waves. Always clean and tidy shore with friendly people enjoying hassle free lifestyle.

title: Quick drive to beach
text: Mereweather Beach I drove down on Sunday.  The sun was out. There was surf about 3 to 5 foot. Was quite large. Nice breeze and lots of parks in the car park..Good place one of the best beaches in Australia

title: Showing off Newcastle to international visitors
text: Mereweather Beach Newcastle has the most beautiful beaches in a relaxed country town environment it’s a must see destination for all travellers

title: Merewether Beach
text:
Mereweather Beach Beautiful beach, great walkway and the baths are a safe place for young kids to swim
One of the nicest beaches in Newcastle

title: Wonderful Beach
text:
Mereweather Beach Love Mereweather beach one of the best around .
All facilities available including great eating and coffee options very close by so need to worry about getting thirsty or hungry whilst enjoying a day here 
Like most beaches parking can be a bit hard at times but worth a little walk if you cannot find any on the esplanade

title: Iconic surfbeach and headland.
text: Mereweather Beach Great place to visit. Scenic views, bathing, great restaurant with amazing views suspended over the busy hub of activity on the boardwalk. Easily accessible.

title: One of the most popular..
text: Mereweather Beach One of if not the most popular beach in Newie! A bit of something for everyone, apart from finding a parking spot on a busy day!!

title: Why travel overseas when Newcastle provides the best beaches
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether Beach, Bar Beach Nobbys and Newcastle provide so many opportunities to enjoy safe and relaxing experiences . They are unquestionably some of the great beaches of the world and as well provide great food and drink facilities to sit back and enjoy the view . Forget the south of France and instead spend your time in Newcastle... the beaches are free

title: Not really for young kids
text: Mereweather Beach Beach lols nice but very rough swell and not really suitable for toddlers and young kids. Getting dunked a lot an perhaps good for strong swimmers and surfers but seen better beaches around Australia. Can get good coffees around the place.

title: One of the best beaches in Australia
text: Mereweather Beach White sand, cliffs in the background, surfers in the water, what else could you ask for on a bright sunny day.

title: Merewether Beach - The best!!!!
text: Mereweather Beach A great beach, good waves, great walks, the best castle views, watch the dolphins surfing the waves, why would you want to go anywhere else. Check it out for yourself.

title: Nice, clean beach
text: Mereweather Beach I came here to stretch my legs after a bit of a drive. Not too many people here, plenty of parking around, lovely spot!

title: Great spot
text: Mereweather Beach Fantastic spot, has a great beach, ocean baths, resturants and pub, walking paths, recommend getting their early to get a park.

title: Excellent beach with beautiful blue water and yellow sand
text: Mereweather Beach A great beach - definitely a must see - highly recommend a trip here with or without the family! Easy access and okay to park etc.

title: Beach is a life
text: Mereweather Beach Great beach caters for the whole family. Body surfing board riding, swimming.is a patrolled beach. Food out let great food.

title: Merewether beach.
text: Mereweather Beach Great swimming beach, patrolled majority of time.  Plenty of parking . Take away food and coffee etc with seating and amenities / toilets Showers change rooms.

title: Mrs
text: Mereweather Beach We live very close to Merewether beach and it is absolutely beautiful and there are coffee places there so it is so nice to have a coffee and take in the view of the ocean

title: Merewether Beach
text:
Mereweather Beach Great beach, great swimming, great surf. The cafe has loads options for snacks, coffee is good.
The surf house has great $10 pizza options for the kids.
Great views to just sit a relax.

title: Merewether Beach
text: Mereweather Beach Visited on Thursday 14th February. This is one of the better beaches in Newcastle with plenty of parking available.

title: Full moon meditation
text: Mereweather Beach Awesome beach, great place for the free Full Moon Meditation, 100's of people gather and proceed to be mesmerised by the sound of the ocean and guided meditation, such a peaceful place on earth

title: Beautiful Place
text: Mereweather Beach merewether = good sandy beach , most times really good surf conditions. caters to the body surfers, boardies and adjacent is 2 open pools... 1 for littlies and the main pool for anyone which is flushed by ocean swell and also emptied Mechanically weekly...merewether has a boardwalk cafe which is most adequate...For up market dining you Merewether Surf House close by...then across the road we have the iconic Beaches Hotel.....if this is not enough further along on the same strip of beach you have Dixon Park surf club

title: Beach walk
text: Mereweather Beach Absolutely love this beach. Lovely easy walk,  lots to see and do. Oven baths to swim in,  rock pools for the kids,  great surfing,  upmarket dining or casual beach cafes on the promenade. Clean water and beach. Watch the whales and dolphins. The home of Surfest. Plenty of parking.

title: Beautiful location!
text: Mereweather Beach Waves, Beach, Surf & Sand. A lovely beach to cool off all year round. The kiosk  opens early for coffee & a snack, plenty of seats & tables. Very clean eating facilities. You can walk down to the beach or sit near Café & watch the surfers & the waves. Bucketlist!

title: Surfer Beach
text: Mereweather Beach This is Newcastle’s beach known for great surfing.  A surfing competition called Surfest is held at this beach.  We saw the preparations being done while we walked the boardwalk.

title: Cool off
text: Mereweather Beach One off the classic beaches to visit has cafes ,restaurant and a beach bathe . Guards on duty change rooms clean and seats to rest. Parking limited

title: Excellent beach like all in the area.
text: Mereweather Beach Pools are seawater, free but grubby unless recently cleaned (not so often by the look of it). Newcastle Beach baths are better looked after.

title: Enormous and safe fresh saltwater pool, sandy beach, cafe and rough surf.
text: Mereweather Beach For average swimmers, the fresh saltwater pool is the way to go when the surf is rough. The pool is emptied and cleaned on a regular published schedule.The surf club pavilion has a cafe and restaurant with great food. Early evening is a great time at the pavilion overlooking the blue ocean.

title: Great Beach in the heart of Newcastle
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether Beach forms part of the Bar Beach, Dixon Park stretch & has a lot of facilities. Cafe's, Ocean Baths and Surf House are all nearby. Great spot to spend a day or an evening!

title: Something for Everyone
text:
Mereweather Beach Watch pink tipped waves break over the huge ocean baths at sunset. Walk along the beach promenade and watch the surfers. Stop at Merewether Surf House for a $10 pizza and beer, or go upstairs for a bar meal or dine in the restaurant.

The little ones love making sandcastles by the safe kids’ ocean pool, wash off under the outdoor showers and there are tables and chairs ideal for family picnics.

Or join the Icebergs who swim at dawn all year round.

What more could you want?

title: Beautiful beach
text: Mereweather Beach I can be biased considering local, but I am sure any one visiting this beach will be enchanted. The baths are fabulous. Very clean beach and patrolled. I don't surf but it is great for surfing I am told.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Mereweather Beach This is just one of Newcastle's beautiful beaches and its also one of the best surfing beaches around.

title: Ocean baths, patrolled beach and great facilities
text: Mereweather Beach Love the ocean baths and rock pools.  Plenty of seating around the pools and in front of the surf club. Surf beach was patrolled, water clear and beautiful.  Adequate parking but still very busy during peak times.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether Beach is my favourite beach. Beautiful headland and Merewether Ocean Baths is the perfect place to cool off with plenty of shaded areas to sit and take in the spectacular view.

title: Very good beach
text: Mereweather Beach Clean and well maintained beach. Excellent concrete walking path. Food and drink options also available close by. Can get busy in peak times.

title: Beautiful
text: Mereweather Beach The beach is great & the baths there are even better for families as the water is calm & shallow. Very relaxing compared to sitting by the beach & having to stand by the waves.

title: Heaven
text: Mereweather Beach What can you say a piece of paradise in the heart of paradise family friendly has lifeguards what more could you want absolutely stunning Beach

title: gorgeous beach with pools as a 2nd option
text: Mereweather Beach On the water in a boat Cruise XP Dominic's tour.Great swell 26 Dec 2018. Highly recommended for children and family.

title: Fantastic
text: Mereweather Beach WOW what a great beach it has surfing and a great place for a swim, it had lifeguards on duty as well. It was very over case and still heaps of people enjoying the beach. 10/10 Would go back.

title: Stunning views
text:
Mereweather Beach What a Beach... Easily the Best
It has Everything.... Waves, Rockpool,Food,Pavilion,Walkway,Ocean Baths!! ENJOY

title: One of the best we've been too
text:
Mereweather Beach Wow! What a beach! Great area for everyone. Has the surf, also has rockpools - plus baths, and a kids beach.
Cannot fault it!
Bonus is there's a cafe/restaurant close by (which overlooks the beach). Great for fries for lunch or a popsicle.

title: a lovely coastal experience
text: Mereweather Beach on a fine day it was great to see this excellent stretch of coast with such a suitable walking path.

title: Went running at Merewether Beach.
text: Mereweather Beach Very scenic beach. All the coast in the vicinity is stunning. Close to Merewether ocean Baths. Lots of facilities ie toilet, shower, kiosk/cafe. Life saving club and patrolled water.

title: Home front
text: Mereweather Beach Great spot for a tinnie after a Kong day at work! Beautiful beach for a swim or surf , has an annual surf festival in February

title: Home to world champion surfers
text: Mereweather Beach Training ground for many of the world surfing champions. This beach has a wonderful coastline, great restaurant/cafes and family friendly.

title: Wonderful long Clean Sandy Surf Beach.
text:
Mereweather Beach Handy to Newcastle City , WonderfulBeach ; Home of World 

Surfing CHAMPION ,Mark RICHARDS .

long Beach , good for All Family . Surf Club Patrolled Beach.

Hotel and Restaurants and Cafes across road.

Safe Beach, large Car park.  Public amenities ,showers , rooms.

title: Lovely place
text: Mereweather Beach Beautiful beach and great for a walk. It has a very welcoming vibe. I have friends living in Newcastle and this is the favourite beach to go to.

title: Windy but wonderful
text: Mereweather Beach Day was recovering from constant rain. Refreshing gale and clearing sky made this a spectacular view, the surf being whipped up, swirling its way to the beach.

title: Weekly walk
text: Mereweather Beach A lovely walk along the esplanade from Merewether beach to Bar Beach then a good coffee at either the Blue Door or further along at Surf House.

title: Baths, beach and food!
text: Mereweather Beach Had a drink and some food from the SLSC, amazing! Reasonably priced and tasty . The baths are lovely to swim in and there is even a seperate area for small kiddies. We also walked along the beach collecting shells. Perfect weather and a perfect day!!

title: Perfect place to visit
text: Mereweather Beach Ideal spot for families, couples and individuals to spend much needed r and r time.  Lots of eateries, both casual and formal. Swim at the beach, wander through the rock pools or swim in the baths.  One of my favourite places.

title: Merewether beach the relaxing hub
text: Mereweather Beach Not just a beach but an environment where entertainment is what you make of it! From the local pub (Beach Hotel) with its breathtaking views up and down the coast line to the boardwalk cafes and restaurants for your dining requirements. Then we also have the walkways and cycle ways that follow the coastline for a relaxing walk or cycle with the sea breeze to cool you on those long hot summer days, and then why not finish off with a dip in the ocean baths or a surf on the majestic waves off Merewether.

title: Great breakfast with beautiful views.
text: Mereweather Beach Had a huge and satisfying breakfast while looking out at one of the best beaches in Australia - truly lucky to live here.

title: Best beach in NSW
text: Mereweather Beach Beautiful beach ,great walk around to the connecting beaches. Childrens pool available. Clean ,safe environment. Walk to the Merewether Surfhouse for coffee or a meal. I spend my summer here!!

title: Great Beach one of the best on the east coast of Australia
text: Mereweather Beach Frequently swim at Merewether Beach and visit cafes which have a variety of great food wonderful ambience and there is always something to see eg....whale watching

title: Follow on from Memorial Drive
text: Mereweather Beach Mereweather Beach is such an icon and a must for visitors to see.great in the summer for swimming but equally nice to walk along in the winter

title: Nice Beach
text: Mereweather Beach This is a nice beach yo visit it has good facilities . The beach is nice to swim In and walk along. A few coffee shops and also baths yo swim in.

title: Surfer's challenge
text: Mereweather Beach Amazing surf beach. The times that I have been there the waves have been not for the faint hearted. Great place however to watch the surfers catch waves and whales pass by.

title: great views
text: Mereweather Beach had a nice lunch with friends at the bar that overlooks the beach was a nice sunny day and the view and the water colour was sensational we toped it off by a nice walk along the boardwalk.

title: Lots of water and surf
text: Mereweather Beach There's often surf, rock-pools, an ocean baths, a carpark, seabirds, whales, dolphins and beach towels. I saw my first dead person here floating face down in the kiddies' pool when i was 10.

title: Best beach in Newcastle
text: Mereweather Beach This is the best beach in Newcastle - it’s suitable for surfers, swimmers, and people of all ages. It is serviced by a surf club as well so swim between the flags. There are also a number of options to eat at the venues along its foreshore.

title: weekly run
text: Mereweather Beach great beach for fun and excersise.. Restraunts and pools plus miles of top beach. Parking was easy and mainly close to the beach and services

title: One of the best
text: Mereweather Beach if you want to visit a beach or go for stroll or eat great food this has it all within walking distance. the scenic walk is great the walkway along the beach is easy and plenty of rest spots to sit and watch the waves or cross the road and watch the action at the skate park. The best is to walk up to the Beach house and have a cold beer and look at all the action and views while enjoying a relaxing drink

title: suburbia meets surf
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether Beach has something to offer everyone irrespective of age or desire. Merewether Beach is situated at the southern end of an uninterupted stretch of golden sand commencing at Bar Beach and including Dixon Park Beach. All three beaches have surf clubs with licensed premises. To the south of Merewether Beach you will find Merewether Ocean Baths which comprises two pools. The smaller pool is intended for families with toddlers. The larger pool measures 100 x 50 metres. The area off the adjacent rock platform is suitable for the experienced snorkler and the more adventurous and confident swimmer. The baths were recently renovated and the amenities have hot (warm) showers. Merewether Beach (like Bar Beach and Dixon Park Beach) are patrolled by Council Life Guards on weekdays and Surf Life Saving Australia Life Savers on weekends. Swimming conditions can vary significantly depending upon tides and wind direction. Merewether Beach hosts "Surfest" , a international surfing competition, annually and is the home break for seven-times world surfing champion Mark Richards and NRL legend Andrew Johns. There is plenty of parking close to the beach, but very limited parking for the disabled. Surf House located between Merewether Beach and Merewether Ocean Baths has a variety of venues serving alcohol and meals for different budgets. The views are spectacular from any of these venues.

title: Gorgeous part of the World
text: Mereweather Beach The esplanade is full of activity! Runners, walkers, dogs, strollers-& such a beautiful view! Perfect place to grab a coffee, stroll along the beach or sit and watch the waves roll in

title: Mother’s Day venue
text: Mereweather Beach This cafe is a special place that my family take me to for my birthday & Mother’s Day every time the view is spectacular and the meals are delicious a favourite for everyone

title: Always Great to see.
text: Mereweather Beach Great sized Carpark and the traffic has been rerouted to have one way streets that make it more enjoyable.

title: So lovely
text: Mereweather Beach We had pizza and ice cream on the esplanade on a July evening and it was beautiful. I can't wait to come back and do it again in summer, glorious location.

title: Social, relaxed, area to watch the surfers
text: Mereweather Beach Stopped here on our way out of town to grab a juice from the cafe and wander along the esplanade to the Merewether Baths. Could have sat here for hours watching the surfers and the passing crowd. Plenty of free parking (4hr limit)

title: Good waves, great sand  and trendy cafes
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether beach is a great place for families and also experienced surfers.  Good facilities and  several cafes and a restaurant are close by.  It is also the site of Newcastle’s Surfest event.   Free Parking abounds

title: Merewether beach
text: Mereweather Beach This is the best spot in Newcastle. Great waves if your a keen surfer. Easy parking and access to cafes and pubs and also has the Merewether ocean baths if the seas are rough.

title: Worth visiting!
text: Mereweather Beach Great beach with a highly accessible walkway and carpark. Very social area.Coffee shops and cafes, family activities, a great concourse for walking, bike riding etc

title: Lovely!
text: Mereweather Beach My favourite beach in Newcastle. I love running from Merewether beach to Bar Beach surfhouse and back, and then take a dip in the Merewether Baths (which are right next to the beach!). Adequate parking unless it's a particularly busy weekend, and there's some decent food and drink options available.

title: My favorite beach in Newcastle
text: Mereweather Beach Just near Merewether baths, this beach is not overly crowded and the view is amazing. Parking is available and way less crowded than all of the other beach. The waves might be a bit big for inexperienced swimmers, so to swim I always go to Bar Beach.

title: One of the best beaches on the East Coast of Australia
text: Mereweather Beach I lived across the road from Merewether Beach for many years and I really love this place. It has everything you can possibly want. Great surf, friendly people, a fantastic cafe that being Surf House with friendly staff, and clean ocean water. I love coming back here whenever I am in Australia.

title: One of the most beautiful beaches :)
text: Mereweather Beach Beautiful beach, great surf and a perfect place for families.  Lifeguard services, change room facilities, cafe/kiosks available, sheltered picnic areas and amazing restaurants.

title: Merewether Beach must see when in Newcastle
text:
Mereweather Beach Great beach and great food establishments. Walk from Merewther to Newcastle is great via memorial walkway.

Get there.

title: Wow.  Wonderful Views
text: Mereweather Beach I don't recall ever being in Merewether in perfect weather until last Saturday.  The water was very clear.  Absolutely stunning.

title: New Baths are brilliant.
text: Mereweather Beach Growing up in Newcastle I am proud to see the wonderful additions and improvements in t.he area since I was young

title: Breathtaking Beach
text: Mereweather Beach We are from Bondi and this beach was breathtaking, Great for young families we used the ocean baths and the rockpools it was a beautiful day! We stayed at Rydges it was a 5 minute drive around the coastline

title: Amazing clean beach
text: Mereweather Beach This beach is beautiful. Clean beach. it is flagged with life guards. Also has near by ocean bars. multiples cafes with coffee and food - cheap $10 pizzas available.

title: The Active Beach
text:
Mereweather Beach This beach was busy. Some were surfing, others were swimming and others were sunbathing. 

Nearby people could order drinks and watch the activities on the beach.

I liked that beach! The waves were a bit stronger in this part of Newcastle. I like that!

Worthwhile to see!

title: Picture of beauty
text: Mereweather Beach Absolutely amazing. Very clean. Even if you don't want to go on the beach it is a beautiful walk. Sit swim or just watch.

title: Great beach
text:
Mereweather Beach What a pleasant surprise! Went for a day trip to Mereweather beach... parking can get a little busy, but we were able to park within a short walking distance.

From the beach with room for kites, surfers on the waves, saltwater bath pools for swimming, rock pools with plenty of sea snails and hermit crabs ... my boys had a great day here! 

Scenic views if you like to walk along the stretch of the coastline. 

Would visit again!

title: Beautiful
text: Mereweather Beach One of the best views in the area to sit back and enjoy a wine! Strongly recommend visiting the beach after a lovely day wine tasting.

title: Getaway
text:
Mereweather Beach Lovely aspect overlooking the sea.
Fine cafe with some good breakfast food , always busy as it’s so popular
Have to be early as the parking is difficult

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Mereweather Beach we visited when the Surfest was taking place. A good buzz to the area. Beautiful beach where our friends regularly swim and surf. A lovely place to walk around and enjoy the views. Very easy to get food as a selection of eateries by the side of the beach

title: Beautiful beach, stunning views!
text: Mereweather Beach We visited Merewether Beach on our way back to Sydney as we had not been to Newcastle. We were glad we did as we had such a great time strolling along the beach and taking in the view. It has lots of benches and there is a cafe facing the sea. We were there in late morning and there were many people there, jogging or walking their dogs. The parking lots are free and convenient,and the beach is quite similar to Bondi. Highly recommended.

title: Just a beautiful beach
text:
Mereweather Beach Walk along the beach promenade from Dixon Park Beach to Merewether Beach and you'll see why this beach got voted Australia's No 1 city beach. A beautiful stretch of sand, often great surf, and always a spot to park - for free.
It's a favourite and my wife and I are here nearly every morning walking our 2 dachshunds and having a coffee at Blue Door cafe.

title: Gorgeous baths!
text: Mereweather Beach I could have stayed in the lovely ocean baths all day long. Covered in beautiful shells and pebbles!

title: Best beach !
text: Mereweather Beach Bar beach is one of the best beaches in Australia. Blue and clean water with spot for kids to play. Very clean and scenic beach. I would strongly recommend visiting with family or alone if visiting Newcastle

title: Fun, Uncrowded Surf Spot
text: Mereweather Beach This stretch of beach is very cool. Beautiful blue water, clean beach, and fun waves. The vibe in the water and on the beach was very relaxed and the locals are super friendly and welcoming. My son and I caught some fish surf fishing of the beach. There are really nice spots to eat on the path just above the beach. Great beach. Very similar to my local beach, Huntington Beach, CA.

title: Stunning beach
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether beach is stunning. Definitely worth the trip to swim in, walk along and just enjoy the scenery!

title: Terrific Little Beach in the Heart of Newcastle
text: Mereweather Beach Newcastle is spoilt for choice with many beaches dotted along the coast but Merewether Beach is a stand out for me. Parking can be hectic but well worth the hunt - toilet & change facilities are next to the beach & nearby pub & cafes make it an easy choice. Great for all the locals as well as tourists - an eclectic mix of families, joggers & tourists make it popular all around.

title: Lunch with family
text: Mereweather Beach Great food with reasonable prices and a good variety on menu, friendly staff great view over mrerweather beach front covered outdoor area.

title: Lovely Newcastle beach
text: Mereweather Beach Great beach, among very many, in Newcastle. Ocean baths, expansive coastline, pathed walkway and a beach cafe. NSW at its finest. Free parking for the organised!

title: Merewether Beach Southern End
text: Mereweather Beach Great spot for a day at the beach with the family. Nice sheltered area to the South near the Baths which is great for kids. Good break a bit North with consistently good small to medium surf. Surfclub Kiosk right behind if you need lunch and a great coffee also. Parking can be hard to find when busy due to the limited amount directly near the beach. You can park across the road and link to the beach via the road underpass walkway. No surprise that Merewether was voted the best beach in the country. Something a local Novocastrian has known for years.

title: Breakfast on the Beach
text: Mereweather Beach Great coffee shop here for Breakfast and right on the beach, food and coffee was great. Service great as well. Surf was huge and surfers having a ball.

title: worth a look
text: Mereweather Beach its a nice beach but the parking situation is kind of crazy and its hard to get in on a weekend that said very pretty worth a look

title: Merewether Beach
text: Mereweather Beach Voted as Newcastle's Best Beach and offers everything for the beach lover.  Ocean baths, surf, Merewhether Surf House, cafes, parks that are all family friendly.  Rivals Bondi any day.

title: Iconic
text: Mereweather Beach Take your pick - surf, ocean baths, the Surf Club, the Beaches Hotel, open parklands, lots of golden sand. A great all-round beach, popular for decades.

title: Awesome Position.
text: Mereweather Beach Close to my mates which is good but there is a club,pub,pizza place all close to the beach. Beach itself is excellent.

title: Nice to enjoy the waves and chill
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether is a great spot to chill and watch the waves and the paragliding from the headland. Parking is easy and there is a cafe if you would like nibbles...

title: Merewether beach
text:
Mereweather Beach The beach is closed to popular pubs, restaurants and hotels. 
Ideal for young families. It has good facilities available.

title: Great place
text: Mereweather Beach really enjoyed our time at Mereweather Beach & Baths, swimming in the salt water baths and then the surf before grabbing some lunch on the beach, wished we could have spent more time

title: Just beautiful
text: Mereweather Beach Merewether Beach is so beautiful. Handy to restaurants. The coastline is so picturesque. Short distance to the harbour foreshore. $15 in a taxi.

title: Great views at sunrise
text: Mereweather Beach A short drive or walk down to the beach is worth it. What a view! Popular with surfers and fishers but enjoyed by all.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Mereweather Beach This beach is clean, and has a kiosk with lots of choices, the staff is helpful and friently, the facilities are very clean

title: summer retreat
text: Mereweather Beach Beautiful beach located centrally. The amazing free swimming pool is a summer blessing. Just close to many other beaches, this is probably the best of Newcastle. Ideal place for coffee lovers, bystanders and children. Place not to be missed ....visit it for yourself and fill in the blanks .....

title: Busy but not packed
text:
Mereweather Beach Last time I was here 2 years ago, Merewether Beach was overcrowded.

Surprisingly, not today. It was busy, but not packed like sardines like last time. Not sure if it's the time of day I visited today or if it's just not as packed as it used to be.

The baths are great and the beach is quite clean and spacious - one of the best in Newcastle.

title: Best beach.
text: Mereweather Beach I lived close to this beach for quite a few years.Their are actually three beaches that form one big beach,they are Bar beach,Cooks hill beach and Merewether.They are well pro trolled beaches and safe for regular and good swimmers.The beach is flat and close proximity to Newcastle city.

title: Top surf
text: Mereweather Beach In my youth I surfed this south point after southerly storms,really liked the winter groundswells.Home surf of Mark Richards
